Bastion
Starting at 3rd level, you learn to use your defensive
might for more than just protection, when an attack
misses you, you gain one Guard Point represented by a
d4, up to a maximum equal to your 1+ your Constitution
modifier (minimum of 2). These points last for 1 minute
You can use these dice in the following manners:
. As a reaction to taking damage, you can expend any
number of Guard Points, rolling the d4s and reducing
the damage by an equal amount.
When a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you
makes an attack roll, you can use your reaction to
expend one Guard Point, rolling the die and
subtracting the number rolled from the creature's roll.
. When you make an attack with your shield, you can
expend any number of Guard Points, adding the
number rolled to the damage you deal,
Shield Bash
Additionally, at 3rd level, you learn to use your shield as a
weapon. You gain proficiency in attacks made with
Shields, they deal 104 + your Strength bludgeoning
damage on a hit, or 1d6 if you have you other hand free

7.featuretext:
Shield Throw
Beginning at 7th level, your proficiency with the shield
reaches new heights, you may now treat your shield as a
throw weapon, with a range of 20/60. The shield always
returns to your hand after the attack.
Magical Aegis
At 7th level, if your shield has a magical bonus, you may
now apply the bonus to your attack and damage rolls, and
the shield count as magical for the purpose of overcoming
resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and
damage.

When you reach 15th level, you can, as a bonus action,
create an area of safety for your allies. lasts for 1 minute
or until you're incapacitated. For the duration, you and

18.featuretext:
Stronghold
Ar 18th level, your mastery with the shield allows you to
soften even the mightiest of blows. While you are
conscious and wielding a shield, you reduce any
bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, force, radiant and
thunder damage by an amount equal to your proficiency
bonus + your Constitution modifier
